column4: it also depends on if your bios supports booting from USB, and if the USB your using actually supports being booted from
so your your bios supports it but your using a USB pen you got free from a cereal box then your never going to be able to boot from it
i got the usb drive from my dad, he had several, and gave me one
does your bios have "usb-hdd/usb-fdd" option in the boot order ?
if your in linux already what did you use to copy the iso to your pen ?
im on bunut 10.04, and ive experienced some problems with wine, and particular programs, im hoping by going to 10.10 i might get later versins of things, and hopefully have better video performance
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/FromUSBStick#Creating a bootable Ubuntu USB flash drive

so you created the bootable pen drive from that app ?, or did you use "dd"

its looking more likelly that the pen itself cant be booted from
ive had trouble with all kingston's, non of them can boot, pny's though can boot
